conclusion: Analyze forces on hemispheres A and B to find the friction coefficient.
Hemispheres A and B are between vertical walls with a 30° angle between their centers and the horizontal.
Consider forces on hemisphere B: weight 2mg downward, contact force F at 30°.
Resolve force F into vertical component: F sin 30° = 2mg, so F = 4mg.
Resolve force F into horizontal component: F cos 30° = F_N, so F_N = 2√3mg.
Consider forces on hemisphere A: weight mg downward, contact force F, normal force F_N1, frictional force F_f upward.
Vertical forces balance: F_f + mg + 2mg = 3mg, so F_f = 2mg.
Maximum static friction force: F_f = μ F_N1, so μ = 1/√3 = √3/3.
Coefficient of friction between hemisphere A and the left wall is √3/3.
